GOD.content: the phrase [“pardon for not meaning (to say)…”] is “up in the air”: an appearance that comes from who knows where, contingency (touch, tact, contact), & pertinent (touching, tact, contact) > dwells suspended in air, even when it touches, meteoric, suspended like Abraham’s knife over Isaac’s head [re: scene of literature, secrecy, forgiveness]
GOD.linkedContent: the phrase [“pardon for not meaning (to say)…”] is “up in the air”: an appearance that comes from who knows where, contingency (touch, tact, contact), & pertinent (touching, tact, contact) > dwells suspended in air, even when it touches, meteoric, suspended like Abraham’s knife over Isaac’s head [re: scene of literature, secrecy, forgiveness]

PAS.content: “quand il la tient, il touche cette force d’approche qui rassemble la proximité, et, dans cette proximité, tout le lointain et tout le dehors”
PAS.linkedContent: “quand il la tient, il touche cette force d’approche qui rassemble la proximité, et, dans cette proximité, tout le lointain et tout le dehors”

PAS.content: le désir de toucher au bord a eu lieu (has taken place), the touching has not, not arrived at its term, sa rive, sa marge ou son bord, sa berge (bank) (ce qui garde et met à l’abri, contre une chute ou une noyade)
PAS.linkedContent: le désir de toucher au bord a eu lieu (has taken place), the touching has not, not arrived at its term, sa rive, sa marge ou son bord, sa berge (bank) (ce qui garde et met à l’abri, contre une chute ou une noyade)

VP.content: in contrast to speech, reflection and touch exteriorize
VP.linkedContent: in contrast to speech, reflection and touch exteriorize

O.content: “la dissémination traite—sur lit (doctors, reads, on bed)—le point où le mouvement de la signification viendrait régulièrement lier le jeu de la trace en produisant ainsi l’histoire”
O.linkedContent: “la dissémination traite—sur lit (doctors, reads, on bed)—le point où le mouvement de la signification viendrait régulièrement lier le jeu de la trace en produisant ainsi l’histoire”

DPi.content: time of bandages: moment before noli me tangere [p. 35n unique moment, since Jesus is generally a touching Jesus], moment where mourning can’t set to work, there’s no corpse > when Mary and Antigone weep over absence of burial
DPi.linkedContent: time of bandages: moment before noli me tangere [p. 35n unique moment, since Jesus is generally a touching Jesus], moment where mourning can’t set to work, there’s no corpse > when Mary and Antigone weep over absence of burial

DPi.content: Nietzsche accuses Kant’s categorical imperative of a hypocritical cruelty, gives itself airs of keeping its hands clean (de n’y pas toucher)
DPi.linkedContent: Nietzsche accuses Kant’s categorical imperative of a hypocritical cruelty, gives itself airs of keeping its hands clean (de n’y pas toucher)

SW.content: sighing (together) before the “veil,” wanting to finally touch the it > to touch “veil” is to touch everything, leaving nothing intact, safe & sound: get caught up in it, nothing will remain
SW.linkedContent: sighing (together) before the “veil,” wanting to finally touch the it > to touch “veil” is to touch everything, leaving nothing intact, safe & sound: get caught up in it, nothing will remain

SW.content: veil as “sa laisse (lead, leash, let)” > tears skin, touches, punctures, pulls, doesn’t just veil gaze; voilà, every word counts
SW.linkedContent: veil as “sa laisse (lead, leash, let)” > tears skin, touches, punctures, pulls, doesn’t just veil gaze; voilà, every word counts

SW.content: after Cixous’ laser surgery, she realizes eyes touch, eyes are hands/lips [lips associated w/ language in Hebrew]
SW.linkedContent: after Cixous’ laser surgery, she realizes eyes touch, eyes are hands/lips [lips associated w/ language in Hebrew]

SW.content: “I like to touch more than to see” [his tallith]
SW.linkedContent: “I like to touch more than to see” [his tallith]

TB.content: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly

TB.content: untouchable: fascinates, orients work of translator

text will be even more virgin, intact, after passage of translation: hymen, sign of virginity, more jealous of itself after the other hymen, the contract signed, marriage consummated (untouchable remnant remains intact)
TB.linkedContent: text will be even more virgin, intact, after passage of translation: hymen, sign of virginity, more jealous of itself after the other hymen, the contract signed, marriage consummated (untouchable remnant remains intact)

TB.content: if axiom “there is no translation of translation” were broken, one would touch, and one must not, the untouchable of the untouchable (that which guarantees originality to the original)
TB.linkedContent: if axiom “there is no translation of translation” were broken, one would touch, and one must not, the untouchable of the untouchable (that which guarantees originality to the original)

PIO.content: via Eros/Psyche myth, impossibility of seeing & touching oneself at same time: mourning, mirror, specularization
PIO.linkedContent: via Eros/Psyche myth, impossibility of seeing & touching oneself at same time: mourning, mirror, specularization

AFR.content: Condillac: we learn externality from touch alone
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: we learn externality from touch alone

AFR.content: Condillac: “sensation becomes idea only by force of touch,” every touch representative of objects the hand holds; sensation of solidity: both idea and feeling, idea as feeling in soul that relates to something outside
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: “sensation becomes idea only by force of touch,” every touch representative of objects the hand holds; sensation of solidity: both idea and feeling, idea as feeling in soul that relates to something outside

C.content: not one (pas un seul) must be forgotten if one wants to see or touch something of the group
C.linkedContent: not one (pas un seul) must be forgotten if one wants to see or touch something of the group

C.content: Derrida means not to touch anything, leave the thing alone, alone w/ you, leave the thing to “the nameless crypt of its mutism” > it knows (how) to keep quiet
C.linkedContent: Derrida means not to touch anything, leave the thing alone, alone w/ you, leave the thing to “the nameless crypt of its mutism” > it knows (how) to keep quiet

C.content: contingent: an attribute, a ration of a series; contingent touches on touch as false-contact; effects of chance, epithet of uncalculable term (échéance), use of nonnecessary become fatal
C.linkedContent: contingent: an attribute, a ration of a series; contingent touches on touch as false-contact; effects of chance, epithet of uncalculable term (échéance), use of nonnecessary become fatal

C.content: principle of order is never untouchable [re: contingent dates of a series]
C.linkedContent: principle of order is never untouchable [re: contingent dates of a series]

C.content: seal of crypt: contingent, “that’s enough” > Derrida left the seal in tact, truly, didn’t touch it
C.linkedContent: seal of crypt: contingent, “that’s enough” > Derrida left the seal in tact, truly, didn’t touch it

LI.content: Sarl understood SEC or was touched by it (found something pertinent)
LI.linkedContent: Sarl understood SEC or was touched by it (found something pertinent)

ATM.content: for Levinas, in search of God uncontaminated by Being, contact is a priori contamination > graver yet: risk of contamination that surfaces before contact, in necessity of tying interruptions together (insistence of ruptures)
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, in search of God uncontaminated by Being, contact is a priori contamination > graver yet: risk of contamination that surfaces before contact, in necessity of tying interruptions together (insistence of ruptures)

OG.content: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]
OG.linkedContent: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]

OG.content: w/ 2 supplements (writing, onanism), auto-affection manifests by leaving a trace of itself in the world, exteriority of space, touchant-touché admits the world as 3rd party, here jouissance and se-donner-une-présence welcome the other in small difference separating l’agir du pâtir (doing from suffering)
OG.linkedContent: w/ 2 supplements (writing, onanism), auto-affection manifests by leaving a trace of itself in the world, exteriority of space, touchant-touché admits the world as 3rd party, here jouissance and se-donner-une-présence welcome the other in small difference separating l’agir du pâtir (doing from suffering)

OG.content: Rousseau’s 2 poles [of original mute writings]: pure pictograph, pure phonograph (presence to thing, presence to voice) [p. (428) “excès” qui “se touchent”] > signifier effaces itself for signified in both cases
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s 2 poles [of original mute writings]: pure pictograph, pure phonograph (presence to thing, presence to voice) [p. (428) “excès” qui “se touchent”] > signifier effaces itself for signified in both cases
